profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: The J.C. McGary papers include one transcribed letter that McGary wrote as a soldier in the American Civil War.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: J.C. McGary was a soldier during the American Civil War. His military unit is unknown as is information about him surviving the war.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The J.C. McGary papers contain one handwritten transcription of a letter to his sister referring to a death in the family and a possible death of a brother. The letter also mentions a battle in the American Civil War in which McGary may have fought. No location was given, but he did indicate being on a horse and a bullet coming through the wheel, possibly indicating he was in a cavalry or artillery unit, or a teamster.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The J.C. McGary papers were arranged in one folder with a title. Currently, the J.C. McGary papers are arranged in one series: I. Correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: J.C. McGary papers, Accession #377, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Paul T. Fisher. Released on 2021-02-12.

controlaccess.head: Places
controlaccess.geogname: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Correspondence.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains one transcribed letter from McGary's service in the American Civil War. This series is in excellent condition.
